Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with trace of handle root; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of elaborate lotus buds in added white outline and added red centres above two white bands; below, part of rosette in white outline with red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of animal frieze (underbelly of goat or feline remaining) to left; rising roundel as filling ornament; below, trace of brown around handle root.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs in the Wild Goat Style, but the interior decoration is not consistent with the that style. Rather, both the exterior and interior decoration reflect the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 252, no. 394)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1552) (phase 2)
